messages.messageBody:
> I am researching the Battle of Sezawa. What I am trying to find out is
> some hard numbers on the troops involved. I can kind of guesstimate
> the Takeda forces, the key word is guess, but I can find nothing about
> Ogasawara Nagatoki, Suwa Yorishige, Murakami Yoshikiyo, and Kiso
> Yoshiyasu. If anybody can come up with an OOB for both sides or at
> least a tip on where to look it would be greatly appreciated.
>
> I have just about all the S. Turnbull books, so no help there. Maybe
> some of you folks would have better sources.
>
> Cheers
> Bill
>

I couldn't find the number of the troops.
According to Kouyougunkan the historical record of Shinano (published
in early Edo period)
describes that Takeda won 1621 heads at the battle.
http://www1.ocn.ne.jp/~oomi/yomono2.html


Sezawa battle field
http://www.fujimikougen.info/kankou/srch/shousai.php3?k_id=086


shikisokuzeku

messages.subject: Battle of Sezawa
messages.msgSnippet: Greetings All, I am researching the Battle of Sezawa. What I am trying to find out is some hard numbers on the troops involved. I can kind of guesstimate the
messages.messageBody:
Greetings All,

I am researching the Battle of Sezawa. What I am trying to find out is
some hard numbers on the troops involved. I can kind of guesstimate
the Takeda forces, the key word is guess, but I can find nothing about
Ogasawara Nagatoki, Suwa Yorishige, Murakami Yoshikiyo, and Kiso
Yoshiyasu. If anybody can come up with an OOB for both sides or at
least a tip on where to look it would be greatly appreciated.

I have just about all the S. Turnbull books, so no help there. Maybe
some of you folks would have better sources.

Cheers
Bill
